Package bricker.gameobjects

Class GraphicLifeCounter

  • java.lang.Object
    • danogl.GameObject
      • bricker.gameobjects.GraphicLifeCounter
  • public class GraphicLifeCounter
extends danogl.GameObject
    Manages a graphical representation of the player's lives in the game. This class extends GameObject and is responsible for displaying life icons or similar graphics to represent the player's remaining lives.
    Version:
    Java 11
    Author:
    Noam Shabat, Samuel Hayat

    • Constructor Detail

      • GraphicLifeCounter

        public GraphicLifeCounter​(danogl.util.Vector2 widgetTopLeftCorner,
                          danogl.util.Vector2 widgetDimensions,
                          danogl.util.Counter livesCounter,
                          danogl.gui.rendering.Renderable widgetRenderable,
                          danogl.collisions.GameObjectCollection gameObjectsCollection,
                          int numOfLives)
        Constructs a new GraphicLifeCounter object.
        Parameters:
        widgetTopLeftCorner - The top left corner of the widget in the game window.
        widgetDimensions - The dimensions of each heart in the life counter.
        livesCounter - The counter object representing the number of lives.
        widgetRenderable - The graphical representation for each heart.
        gameObjectsCollection - Collection of all game objects for adding/removing hearts.
        numOfLives - Initial number of lives.

    • Method Detail

      • initiateHearts

        private void initiateHearts()
        Initializes heart objects according to the initial number of lives.

      • update

        public void update​(float deltaTime)
        Updates the life counter every frame. Adjusts the number of heart objects to match the current number of lives.
        Overrides:
        update in class danogl.GameObject
        Parameters:
        deltaTime - Time since the last update.

      • createHeart

        private void createHeart​(int heartId)
        Creates a heart object at a specified index.
        Parameters:
        heartId - The index at which the heart object should be created.
